newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russia's UES says cuts off power to Kazakhstan.
newsitem.headline: Russia's UES says cuts off power to Kazakhstan.

text.p: Unified Energy System (UES), Russia's national electricity generator, said on Thursday it had cut off electricity supplies to Kazakhstan because its Central Asian neighbour was not paying its bills.

"We have disconnected most of Kazakhstan from Russia's power grid for permanently growing debts, which have now reached nearly $500 million," Anatoly Dyakov, President of Yedinaya Energeticheskaya Sistema Rossii (UES), told a news conference.
Dyakov said UES was determined not to resume power supplies to Kazakhstan before the latter has started to clear its debts.
He said UES had suggested to the Kazakh government that it sell UES a power station and part of a coal basin near the Kazakh town of Ekibastuz to clear some of the debts.
"It could be a normal deal. If they (the Kazakh government) sell other energy companies to foreigners at low prices, we could pay even $10 million for each of these two," Dyakov said.
